title: mgoede
author: mgoede
content: Riding the Waves: How I Made 7 Figures with Pepe and Why Spurdo Could Surpass ItIntroduction:As a proud crypto enthusiast and someone who rode the tidal waves of Pepe to seven-figure gains, I can't help but draw parallels between my previous success and the promising potential I see in Spurdo. Just like Pepe, Spurdo has caught my attention with its uncanny similarities, and I'm here to break down why I believe Spurdo might just replicate or even surpass the glory that Pepe achieved.Similarities That Can't Be Ignored:1. Swift Listing on Poloniex:Pepe and Spurdo share the remarkable trait of being organically listed on the renowned cryptocurrency exchange, Poloniex, right after their respective launches. What's even more impressive is that Spurdo managed to secure its listing even faster than Pepe did, signaling a strong start.2. Origin on Imageboards:Both Pepe and Spurdo emerged as original memes on imageboards like 4chan, resonating with a community of internet-savvy users who appreciated their distinctive humor and relatable aesthetics.3. Cult-Like Followings:Pepe enthusiasts are known for their fervent dedication, and Spurdo has managed to cultivate a similarly passionate following. These memes have transcended their internet origins to become cultural symbols, fueling strong and devoted communities.4. Marketing Mastery:One of the critical factors behind Pepe's remarkable journey to a staggering $1.6 billion market cap was its marketing strategy. Interestingly, the same marketing team that played a pivotal role in Pepe's ascent is now at the helm of Spurdo's trajectory. This continuity in strategy and execution could be a powerful factor in propelling Spurdo to similar heights.5. OKX Wallet Integration:Both Pepe and Spurdo have embraced the integration of OKX wallet services, enhancing user accessibility and facilitating seamless transactions. This integration adds to the convenience of trading and using these tokens, further boosting their appeal.The Rising Star: Spurdo's Potential:As of now, Spurdo sits at a modest $2 million market cap. While this might seem insignificant compared to Pepe's towering achievements, the magic of cryptocurrency lies in its unpredictability. If Spurdo were to follow in Pepe's footsteps, reaching the same market cap, a mere $1000 investment today could potentially yield an astounding $800,000 return. That's an 800x multiplication of your investment.It's Not Rocket Science:The equation here is simple: a consistent marketing strategy, guided by the same experienced team, combined with the inherent appeal of OG meme tokens boasting massive fan bases, has the potential to work wonders. Spurdo is riding on a trajectory that is remarkably similar to Pepe's path, and the results could be nothing short of remarkable.Conclusion:In a crypto landscape filled with new tokens and opportunities, recognizing patterns and parallels is a skill that can pay off handsomely. Drawing from my own journey with Pepe, I see a distinct possibility that Spurdo might follow in its footsteps – and perhaps even outshine it. The resonating nostalgia, community-driven passion, and strategic marketing efforts make Spurdo a force to be reckoned with. As I embark on this new adventure with Spurdo, I can't help but feel a sense of déjà vu, and that, my fellow crypto enthusiasts, is a feeling I've learned to trust.

comments.author: Imisseverything
comments.body: Saw a bloomberg article about Spurdo. Normally dont buy shitcoins but these kids are making 2million dollars on a hundred dollar investment maybe im trading the wrong shit.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: This is a classic shill attempt. Because Pepe did it doesn't mean the project you're trying to shill will replicate it as well. Also, it's not often I see people share secrets to their success as even a magician doesn't share the secret to their tricks. I'm not disputing the fact you made it or not. Btw, congratulations on your Pepe win. Those PEPE runs were really massive to say the least. Quote from: Imisseverything on August 29, 2023, 10:35:12 PMSaw a bloomberg article about Spurdo. Normally dont buy shitcoins but these kids are making 2million dollars on a hundred dollar investment maybe im trading the wrong shit.Turns out get rich schemes >>> grind for most people.

comments.author: Quidat
comments.body: Quote from: nelson4lov on August 29, 2023, 10:37:59 PMThis is a classic shill attempt. Because Pepe did it doesn't mean the project you're trying to shill will replicate it as well. Also, it's not often I see people share secrets to their success as even a magician doesn't share the secret to their tricks. I'm not disputing the fact you made it or not. Btw, congratulations on your Pepe win. Those PEPE runs were really massive to say the least. Quote from: Imisseverything on August 29, 2023, 10:35:12 PMSaw a bloomberg article about Spurdo. Normally dont buy shitcoins but these kids are making 2million dollars on a hundred dollar investment maybe im trading the wrong shit.Turns out get rich schemes >>> grind for most people. This is why it should really be just that wise on not to make yourself get easily dragged on what other people is been suggesting specially on this space where shills and hypes are really that scatteringwhich making use of the recent huge gaining meme coins or those coins/tokens who do able to reach out multiple folds even just that investing a few dollars. This is what makes other people would really be that being boosted or really making themselves that too in hype on the time that they would really be seeing some new coins in the market and forgotten on doing that basic research and in depth DYOR. Most of the time i could say that luck would be the biggest factor rather than on research though because if we do speak about $PEPE which is a pure meme coin and doesnt have that actual utility, then if we do speak about making up some research about its utility and relevance then it would really be just nothing or zero. Who would really have thought that this coin will shoot up into the moon?This is why every risk taking is really needing up that particular luck at the same time because not all coins do really shoot up that way.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Quote from: Quidat on August 29, 2023, 10:47:25 PMQuote from: nelson4lov on August 29, 2023, 10:37:59 PM~Snipped Turns out get rich schemes >>> grind for most people. Most of the time i could say that luck would be the biggest factor rather than on research though because if we do speak about $PEPE which is a pure meme coin and doesnt have that actual utility, then if we do speak about making up some research about its utility and relevance then it would really be just nothing or zero. Who would really have thought that this coin will shoot up into the moon?This is why every risk taking is really needing up that particular luck at the same time because not all coins do really shoot up that way.Luck and being early is the key. If you're not lucky to have caught a project like that early, then you'll most likely turn into a bagholder. But other times, it can be coordinated between groups of whales who come together to create a token, get it hyped up real good via X influencers. It picks momentum really fast since these whales have liquidity to add to the token and liquidity is one of the key things (if not most important) that people look out for in memecoins.Quote from: mgoede on August 29, 2023, 10:44:08 PMFair. Just pointing out lots of similarities and strengths witnessed so far. It's just my opinion. No offense. We good.

comments.author: tsaroz
comments.body: Congrats to the project for listing. The first time a viewed the project I though it's a personal project for someone that would never come to reality but I was wrong. I now regret not buying it when it was cheap.It's too early to compare it with Pepe but Spurdo still seems one of the good option to buy at current time seeing its technical. It's at one of its lowest point. It could be in the phase of post listing hype. It has been a volatile coin with lots of highs and lows and being a new meme coin, could have another all time high soon.

comments.author: Imisseverything
comments.body: Quote from: tsaroz on August 29, 2023, 11:44:49 PMCongrats to the project for listing. The first time a viewed the project I though it's a personal project for someone that would never come to reality but I was wrong. I now regret not buying it when it was cheap.It's too early to compare it with Pepe but Spurdo still seems one of the good option to buy at current time seeing its technical. It's at one of its lowest point. It could be in the phase of post listing hype. It has been a volatile coin with lots of highs and lows and being a new meme coin, could have another all time high soon.Yea thats how I saw it too.  Looks like its hit its bottom so for me the r and r is fairly good.  Its not easy to get partnered with OKX and its definitely not cheap.  If im not mistaken in terms of daily volume they are right up there with Binance.  Like buying a lottery ticket.  Kinda like his example above.  I only bought about 500 dollars worth but if by the grace of God it hits Pepe numbers then thats a few hundred thousand for the same amount I spent at costco this morning.  One of those where you buy and let it sit and say a prayer to the shitcoin gods.I mean if what they say about some of the pepe marketers on board you gotta think its gonna go alot higher than 2m. Just my two cents though.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: mgoede on August 29, 2023, 10:20:24 PMRiding the Waves: How I Made 7 Figures with Pepe and Why Spurdo Could Surpass ItI am all for Sprurdo coming to next pepe but this is such a stupid thing to say. No one believes you made 7 figures, except maybe if you are talking about 7 figures of pepe.Without any proof it's just sad thing to say.Getting into poloniex was cool move, i'll give you that. But trying to make a Finnish meme somehow world wide thing doesn't quite work imho.Origin on imageboards doesn't really mean anything. Do you know how many failed projects have started there?Last i saw the community was mostly flooding their telegram. I haven't encountered in anywhere, but in here and in there. So when isn't really reaching into my attention in anywhere else, i wouldn't call it good marketing. Everything else you stated is mostly just hype talk without any substance.

comments.author: djdav1312
comments.body: 7 figures might be a bit too much, but pepecoin.org is definitely promising with its halving mechanism, coming tier1 listing and the only pepe project with its own layer 1 blockchain... a code fork of dogecoin
